lessons.title: What is a Computer Keyboard?
lessons.content:

lessons.title: Layout of the Keyboard
lessons.content:
The keyboard layout shows how keys are arranged on a computer keyboard. Knowing the layout helps you find keys faster and type more correctly. Most computer keyboards use the QWERTY layout, named after the first six letters on the top letter row (Q, W, E, R, T, Y).

1. What is a Keyboard Layout?
A keyboard layout is the pattern of keys on the keyboard. It tells you where letters, numbers, symbols, and control keys are located. The layout is designed to make typing easy and efficient.

2. The QWERTY Layout
ğŸ‘‰ The QWERTY layout is the most common layout used around the world.
ğŸ‘‰ It was designed to reduce key jams on old typewriters by spreading out commonly used letters.
ğŸ‘‰ It helps users type quickly and accurately once they learn the key positions.

3. Main Sections of the Keyboard
Keyboards are divided into five main groups:
âœ… Letter Keys â€“ These are the Aâ€“Z keys used to type words.
âœ… Number Keys â€“ These include 0â€“9 keys above the letters and on the numeric keypad.
âœ… Function Keys â€“ F1 to F12 are at the top. They perform special actions like opening help, refreshing, or adjusting settings.
âœ… Navigation Keys â€“ These include the arrow keys, Home, End, Page Up, and Page Down for moving the cursor or scrolling.
âœ… Special Keys â€“ These include Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Enter, Backspace, and the Spacebar, which help in controlling actions and typing symbols.

4. Other Keyboard Layouts
ğŸ‘‰ AZERTY â€“ Mostly used in France and some European countries.
ğŸ‘‰ DVORAK â€“ Designed to increase speed and reduce finger movement.
ğŸ‘‰ QWERTZ â€“ Common in Central Europe.
Different layouts are used in different countries and languages.

5. Importance of Knowing the Keyboard Layout
âœ… Helps you locate keys faster.
âœ… Increases your typing speed.
âœ… Reduces typing errors.
âœ… Makes it easier to use shortcuts and special characters.



Remember: Practicing regularly with your keyboard layout helps you type confidently without looking at the keys!

lessons.title: Categories of Keys
lessons.content:
The keyboard is made up of many keys that are grouped according to their functions. Each group of keys performs different tasks to help you type letters, numbers, symbols, and control your computer easily. Understanding these categories helps you use the keyboard correctly and efficiently.

1. Alphanumeric Keys
These are the most commonly used keys on the keyboard. They include all the letters (Aâ€“Z) and numbers (0â€“9). You use them to type words, sentences, and numbers. The spacebar is used to separate words, while the Enter key helps to move to a new line.

2. Function Keys (F1â€“F12)
Located at the top of the keyboard, these keys perform special tasks depending on the program you are using. For example:
ğŸ‘‰ F1 opens help,
ğŸ‘‰ F5 refreshes a page,
ğŸ‘‰ F11 switches full-screen mode.
They make computer operations faster and easier.

3. Control Keys
These keys are used to give commands or shortcuts to the computer. They include Ctrl (Control), Alt (Alternate), Windows, and Esc (Escape) keys. When pressed with other keys, they perform special tasks like copying (Ctrl + C), pasting (Ctrl + V), or closing windows (Alt + F4).

4. Navigation Keys
These help you move the cursor or screen in documents and web pages. They include the arrow keys (â† â†‘ â†“ â†’), Home, End, Page Up, and Page Down. They are very useful when editing text or browsing pages.

5. Numeric Keypad
The numeric keypad is found on the right side of most keyboards. It contains numbers (0â€“9) and symbols (+, â€“, *, /). It is used for quick entry of numbers and calculations, especially in accounting or data entry tasks.

6. Special Keys
These include Enter, Shift, Caps Lock, Backspace, and Spacebar. They help control how you type, move to new lines, or delete mistakes.

7. Importance of Knowing the Categories
âœ… Makes typing easier and faster.
âœ… Helps you use keyboard shortcuts confidently.
âœ… Improves your computer skills and accuracy.



Remember: Every key on the keyboard has a purpose. Knowing the different categories helps you become a smart and skillful computer user!

lessons.title: Special Keys and Their Functions
lessons.content:
Special keys are the keys on the keyboard that perform specific tasks other than typing letters or numbers. They help control actions, commands, and shortcuts when working on a computer. Learning their functions makes typing faster and more efficient.

1. What Are Special Keys?
Special keys are designed to perform unique functions. They allow users to delete, move, select, and control operations easily. These keys work alone or in combination with other keys.

2. Examples of Common Special Keys
ğŸ‘‰ Shift Key â€“ Used to type capital letters or special symbols when held with another key. (Example: Shift + a = A, Shift + 2 = @).
ğŸ‘‰ Caps Lock Key â€“ When turned on, all letters you type appear in capital form. Press it again to turn it off.
ğŸ‘‰ Tab Key â€“ Moves the cursor to the next tab space or field. Useful in forms and documents.
ğŸ‘‰ Enter Key â€“ Used to start a new line in typing or confirm a command.
ğŸ‘‰ Backspace Key â€“ Deletes the letter or space to the left of the cursor.
ğŸ‘‰ Delete Key â€“ Removes the letter or space to the right of the cursor.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl (Control) Key â€“ Used with other keys for shortcuts (e.g., Ctrl + C to copy, Ctrl + V to paste).
ğŸ‘‰ Alt (Alternate) Key â€“ Works with other keys to perform special commands or access menus (e.g., Alt + Tab to switch between windows).
ğŸ‘‰ Esc (Escape) Key â€“ Cancels a task or closes a dialog box.
ğŸ‘‰ Spacebar â€“ Adds spaces between words while typing.
ğŸ‘‰ Windows Key â€“ Opens the Start menu in Windows computers.
ğŸ‘‰ Fn Key â€“ Found mostly on laptops; used to activate secondary functions of other keys (like brightness or volume).

3. Importance of Special Keys
âœ… Help perform tasks quickly and easily.
âœ… Save time by reducing mouse use.
âœ… Allow the use of shortcuts for copy, paste, and undo.
âœ… Improve speed and efficiency in typing and navigation.

4. Tips for Using Special Keys
ğŸ‘‰ Practice using common shortcuts daily (like Ctrl + Z to undo mistakes).
ğŸ‘‰ Learn the position of each special key for faster access.
ğŸ‘‰ Combine special keys with letters to use powerful keyboard commands.

5. Fun Shortcuts to Try
ğŸ’¡ Ctrl + A â†’ Select All text.
ğŸ’¡ Ctrl + S â†’ Save your document.
ğŸ’¡ Ctrl + P â†’ Print your file.
ğŸ’¡ Alt + F4 â†’ Close the current program.



Remember: Special keys are powerful tools that make using your computer faster and easier. The more you practice, the more confident you become!

lessons.title: How to Use the Keyboard for Typing
lessons.content:
Learning how to use the keyboard correctly helps you type faster and more accurately. Typing is an important skill for school work, communication, and computer use.

1. What is Typing?
Typing means pressing keys on the keyboard to write words, sentences, or numbers on the screen. Good typing skills save time and make your work neat and professional.

2. The Home Row Keys
The home row keys are the base position for your fingers when typing.
ğŸ‘‰ Left hand: A, S, D, F
ğŸ‘‰ Right hand: J, K, L, ;
Your fingers should always return to these keys after pressing other keys. The small bumps on F and J help you find your place without looking down.

3. Correct Finger Placement
Each finger has its own keys to press. This helps you type smoothly and without mistakes.
ğŸ‘‰ Use your thumbs for the spacebar.
ğŸ‘‰ Keep your fingers slightly curved over the home row.
ğŸ‘‰ Avoid using one finger for all keys (called 'hunt and peck').

4. Good Typing Posture
Sit up straight with both feet flat on the floor. Keep your wrists slightly raised and avoid resting them on the table. Your eyes should look at the screen, not the keyboard.

5. Practice for Speed and Accuracy
Typing fast is not as important as typing correctly. Start slowly and focus on hitting the right keys. With daily practice, your speed will naturally increase.

6. Tips to Improve Typing
âœ… Practice typing short words, then move to sentences.
âœ… Use typing tutor games or practice lessons daily.
âœ… Avoid looking at your fingers when typing.
âœ… Keep your hands clean and dry before typing.

7. Importance of Typing Skills
Typing skills help students complete assignments faster, send emails, write reports, and use computers for creative work like coding or design.



Remember: The more you practice, the better you type! Stay patient and enjoy learning.

lessons.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
lessons.content:
Keyboard shortcuts are special key combinations that help you perform tasks quickly without using the mouse. They save time and make your work faster and easier. Instead of clicking through menus, you can press two or more keys together to get the same result.

1. What Are Keyboard Shortcuts?
A keyboard shortcut is a combination of keys that performs a specific action. For example, pressing Ctrl + C copies text, and Ctrl + V pastes it. Shortcuts are useful for typing, editing, and managing files on a computer.

2. Commonly Used Shortcuts
Here are some popular and useful keyboard shortcuts:
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + C â€“ Copy selected text or items.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + V â€“ Paste copied or cut text or items.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + X â€“ Cut (remove) selected text or items.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + Z â€“ Undo your last action.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + Y â€“ Redo an action you just undid.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + S â€“ Save your work or document.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + P â€“ Print your file.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + A â€“ Select all text or items in a document.
ğŸ‘‰ Alt + Tab â€“ Switch between open windows.
ğŸ‘‰ Ctrl + Alt + Delete â€“ Open the Task Manager or restart the computer.

3. Why Keyboard Shortcuts Are Important
âœ… Save time and effort.
âœ… Reduce the need to use the mouse.
âœ… Help you work more efficiently on documents and programs.
âœ… Make you look like a computer pro!

4. Tips for Practicing Shortcuts
ğŸ‘‰ Start with simple ones like Copy (Ctrl + C) and Paste (Ctrl + V).
ğŸ‘‰ Use them every day while typing or editing.
ğŸ‘‰ Write them on a small note until you memorize them.

5. Fun Fact
Keyboard shortcuts work slightly differently in different programs, but the most common ones like Ctrl + C and Ctrl + V work almost everywhere!



Remember: Shortcuts make your work quicker, smarter, and more fun! The more you use them, the faster you become.

lessons.title: What is a Computer?
lessons.content:
A computer is an electronic device that receives, processes, and stores data.

ğŸ‘‰ Computers perform tasks quickly and accurately.

lessons.title: Parts of a Computer
lessons.content:
A computer is made up of different parts that work together to help it perform various tasks. Each part has a specific role that allows us to input data, process it, and see the result. Understanding these parts helps us use the computer correctly and take care of it.

1. Main Parts of a Computer
ğŸ‘‰ Central Processing Unit (CPU)
The CPU is called the brain of the computer. It processes all the data and instructions given to the computer. It performs calculations and controls all other parts. The CPU has three main parts â€” the Control Unit, Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU), and Memory Unit.

ğŸ‘‰ Monitor
The monitor is the output device that displays information, pictures, videos, and text from the computer. It allows you to see what you are doing.

ğŸ‘‰ Keyboard
The keyboard is an input device used for typing letters, numbers, and commands into the computer. It helps you enter data and control programs.

ğŸ‘‰ Mouse
The mouse is also an input device. It helps you move the pointer on the screen, click on icons, and select or drag items. It makes navigation easy.

ğŸ‘‰ Storage Devices
These are devices that store data and programs for future use. Examples include the hard disk, flash drive, CD, and external drives. They keep your files safe even when the computer is turned off.

ğŸ‘‰ Speakers
Speakers are output devices that produce sound. They allow you to listen to music, videos, or other audio from the computer.

2. Additional Parts
Other helpful parts include:
âœ… Printer â€“ produces a hard copy of your work.
âœ… Scanner â€“ copies pictures or documents into the computer.
âœ… Webcam â€“ captures live videos and images.
âœ… Microphone â€“ records your voice or sound.

3. Importance of Knowing Computer Parts
âœ… Helps you use each part correctly.
âœ… Makes it easier to identify and solve problems.
âœ… Improves your understanding of how computers work.



Remember: Every part of the computer has a special function. When all parts work together, the computer performs tasks quickly and efficiently!

lessons.title: Input, Output, and Storage Devices
lessons.content:
Computers use different devices to receive, process, display, and store information. These devices are grouped into three main categories: **Input Devices**, **Output Devices**, and **Storage Devices**.

ğŸ¯ **Input Devices** â€“ These are tools we use to send data or commands into the computer. They allow us to communicate and control the system.

â€¢ **Keyboard** â€“ Used for typing letters, numbers, and symbols into the computer.
â€¢ **Mouse** â€“ Used to move the pointer, click, and select items on the screen.
â€¢ **Microphone** â€“ Records or inputs sound into the computer, such as voice commands or music.
â€¢ **Scanner** â€“ Copies images and documents into digital form that the computer can read.
â€¢ **Camera / Webcam** â€“ Captures pictures and videos, often used for video calls or online learning.
â€¢ **Joystick** â€“ Used mainly for playing games and controlling movement in simulations.

ğŸ’¡ Input devices help us give information and instructions to the computer easily.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ **Output Devices** â€“ These show or present the results produced by the computer after processing data. They help the computer communicate with us.

â€¢ **Monitor** â€“ Displays text, pictures, and videos so we can see what the computer is doing.
â€¢ **Printer** â€“ Produces a hard copy of what is on the screen, such as documents or pictures.
â€¢ **Speakers** â€“ Play sound output from the computer, such as music, voice, or alerts.
â€¢ **Headphones / Earphones** â€“ Let users listen to sound privately without disturbing others.
â€¢ **Projector** â€“ Displays images or presentations on a large screen for classrooms or meetings.

ğŸ’¡ Output devices allow the computer to share its results through sound, visuals, or printouts.

ğŸ’¾ **Storage Devices** â€“ These are used to save data and files permanently or temporarily. They store programs, documents, music, and videos for future use.

â€¢ **Hard Disk Drive (HDD)** â€“ Stores large amounts of data inside the computer permanently.
â€¢ **Solid-State Drive (SSD)** â€“ A faster type of internal storage with no moving parts.
â€¢ **Flash Drive / Pen Drive** â€“ A portable device used to transfer and store files between computers.
â€¢ **Memory Card** â€“ Used in cameras, phones, and tablets to store photos, videos, and apps.
â€¢ **CD / DVD** â€“ Discs used to store music, movies, or software.
â€¢ **External Hard Drive** â€“ A removable device used to back up or carry large files.

ğŸ’¡ Storage devices keep our work safe for future use and allow easy file sharing.

In summary, **input devices** send data to the computer, **output devices** show results, and **storage devices** keep information for later use. All three work together to make a computer useful and efficient.

lessons.title: Safe Use of Computers
lessons.content:
Computers are fun and useful, but it is important to use them safely to protect our health, our data, and ourselves online. Following good safety habits keeps both you and your computer in good condition.

ğŸ’» **1. Physical Safety and Posture**
â€¢ Always sit properly when using the computer. Keep your back straight and your feet flat on the floor.
â€¢ Place the computer screen at eye level to avoid neck pain.
â€¢ Keep your wrists straight while typing and use a comfortable chair.
â€¢ Do not sit too close to the monitor â€” keep a safe distance of about an armâ€™s length.
â€¢ Take regular breaks every 20â€“30 minutes to rest your eyes and stretch your body.
â€¢ Avoid using the computer in dark rooms â€” ensure good lighting to prevent eye strain.

ğŸ§  **2. Health and Hygiene Tips**
â€¢ Wash your hands before and after using a shared computer to stay clean and healthy.
â€¢ Do not eat or drink near the computer to prevent damage from spills.
â€¢ Keep the keyboard, mouse, and screen clean and free of dust.

ğŸ” **3. Digital Safety and Security**
â€¢ Use **strong passwords** that combine letters, numbers, and symbols to protect your accounts.
â€¢ Never share your passwords with anyone except a trusted adult or teacher.
â€¢ Always **log out** after using public or shared computers.
â€¢ Avoid clicking on strange links or pop-up messages â€” they may contain harmful software (viruses).
â€¢ Ask an adult before downloading files, installing programs, or visiting new websites.
â€¢ Do not share personal information such as your full name, home address, school, or phone number online.

ğŸŒ **4. Responsible and Respectful Use**
â€¢ Use the computer for learning, creativity, and positive communication.
â€¢ Be kind and respectful when chatting or posting online â€” no cyberbullying.
â€¢ Always give credit when you use other peopleâ€™s work, pictures, or ideas.

ğŸ§© **5. Equipment Safety**
â€¢ Shut down the computer properly after use.
â€¢ Keep liquids away from the keyboard and power cables.
â€¢ Avoid overloading sockets or using wet hands when touching electrical plugs.
â€¢ Report any broken wires or sparks to an adult immediately.

âœ… When you follow these safety rules, you will enjoy using computers in a healthy, secure, and responsible way.

lessons.title: Introduction to Coding
lessons.content:
Coding means giving a computer a set of instructions to follow so that it can perform tasks correctly. It helps us tell computers what to do in a language they understand.

ğŸ’¡ **What is Coding?**
â€¢ Coding is also called **programming**. It is how we communicate with computers to make them work.
â€¢ A **program** is a list of instructions written in a coding language.
â€¢ Coding helps create things like games, websites, apps, and robots.

ğŸ¯ **Why Learn Coding?**
â€¢ Coding builds problem-solving and logical thinking skills.
â€¢ It helps children become creative thinkers and inventors.
â€¢ It is an important skill for the future because many jobs use computers and technology.

ğŸ§© **Examples of Coding Languages**
â€¢ **Scratch** â€“ A fun, colorful, block-based coding language for beginners.
â€¢ **Python** â€“ Easy to read and great for learning text-based coding.
â€¢ **JavaScript** â€“ Used to make websites interactive.

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» **How Coding Works**
1. You write instructions (code) using a programming language.
2. The computer reads and follows the instructions step by step.
3. If there are mistakes, you **debug** (fix) the errors.
4. You test and improve your program until it works well.

ğŸš€ **Simple Example**
Imagine you want a robot to move forward:
â€¢ You might write a code like: **move forward 5 steps**
â€¢ If you want it to turn, you add: **turn right**
â€¢ Step-by-step, you build commands that make the robot complete a task!

ğŸ’¬ **Fun Fact:** Coding is like giving instructions to your friend in a game â€” you must be clear and correct, or your friend might get confused!

âœ… **In Summary:** Coding helps us control computers and make them do useful, fun, and creative things. Anyone can learn coding â€” start simple and grow with practice!

lessons.title: Scratch and Block Coding
lessons.content:
Scratch is a fun and easy way to learn coding. It uses **colorful visual blocks** instead of complicated text commands. By dragging and connecting these blocks, children can create animations, games, and stories.

ğŸ’¡ **What is Scratch?**
â€¢ Scratch is a beginner-friendly programming platform designed for kids.
â€¢ It teaches how to code by using blocks that fit together like puzzle pieces.
â€¢ Each block represents an instruction or command.
â€¢ The blocks control **sprites** (characters or objects) that can move, talk, and react.

1. Choose a sprite (character) and a background (stage).

ğŸ§© **Key Coding Concepts You Learn in Scratch**
â€¢ **Sequencing** â€“ Putting instructions in the correct order so actions happen step by step.
â€¢ **Loops (Repeat)** â€“ Making actions happen again and again without writing the same code many times.
â€¢ **Events** â€“ Making something happen when a key is pressed, when the green flag is clicked, or when sprites touch.
â€¢ **Conditions (If/Then)** â€“ Making decisions, such as: *If the score is 10, show â€˜You Win!â€™*

ğŸŒŸ **Why Scratch is Great for Kids**

â€¢ You can make your own cartoons, quizzes, and mini-games.
â€¢ It encourages problem-solving, logical thinking, and storytelling.
â€¢ You can share your projects online with friends and see othersâ€™ creations.

âœ… **In Summary:** Scratch and block coding help children learn the basics of programming in an exciting way. By snapping colorful blocks together, anyone can build amazing projects and start thinking like a programmer!

lessons.title: Algorithms for Kids
lessons.content:
An **algorithm** is a set of clear, step-by-step instructions used to solve a problem or complete a task. Algorithms help us plan what to do and in what order to do it â€” just like giving directions to a friend or writing a recipe!

ğŸ’¡ **What is an Algorithm?**
â€¢ In simple terms, an algorithm tells the computer what steps to take to get the correct result.
â€¢ Algorithms are the foundation of coding and programming.
â€¢ Every computer program or game follows an algorithm to work properly.

ğŸ§© **Examples of Algorithms in Daily Life**
â€¢ **Making a Sandwich:**
1. Take two slices of bread.
2. Spread butter or jam.
3. Put the slices together.
4. Eat your sandwich!

â€¢ **Brushing Your Teeth:**
1. Pick up your toothbrush.
2. Put toothpaste on it.
3. Brush all your teeth.
4. Rinse your mouth.

â€¢ **Playing a Game:**
1. Start the game.
2. Follow the rules.
3. Score points.
4. Win or try again!

ğŸ§  **In Coding:**
â€¢ Algorithms tell the computer what to do step by step.
â€¢ Programmers write algorithms using coding languages.
â€¢ Computers can only follow instructions if they are clear and in the correct order.

ğŸ” **Why Algorithms Are Important**
â€¢ They help us solve problems in a logical and organized way.
â€¢ They make programs work faster and more accurately.

sections.title: Uses of the Internet
sections.content:
The Internet is a worldwide network that connects millions of computers, allowing people to share information and communicate instantly. It makes learning, working, and connecting with others much easier.

ğŸ‘‰ **Entertainment:** You can listen to music, play games, or watch movies online.
ğŸ‘‰ **Shopping and Banking:** People can buy goods or transfer money safely using online services.
ğŸ‘‰ **Information Sharing:** The Internet helps people share ideas and stay informed about what is happening around the world.

Always use the Internet wisely and remember to ask an adult before visiting a new website.

sections.title: Online Safety for Kids
sections.content:
While the Internet is full of fun and useful information, it is also important to stay safe while using it. Online safety means protecting yourself, your personal data, and your computer from harm.

ğŸ‘‰ **Do not share personal details:** Never post your full name, address, school name, or phone number online.
ğŸ‘‰ **Ask an adult for help:** Always tell a parent or teacher if you see something strange or scary online.
ğŸ‘‰ **Use strong passwords:** Mix letters, numbers, and symbols to make your password harder to guess.
ğŸ‘‰ **Avoid strangers:** Do not chat or share pictures with people you donâ€™t know.
ğŸ‘‰ **Be kind online:** Treat others with respect when using social media or chat apps.
ğŸ‘‰ **Donâ€™t download unknown files:** They may contain viruses that harm your computer.

Online safety keeps you protected, happy, and confident while using the Internet.

sections.title: Web Browsers and Search Engines
sections.content:
To explore the Internet, we use tools called **web browsers** and **search engines**. A browser is a software that allows us to open and view websites, while a search engine helps us find information quickly.

ğŸ‘‰ **Examples of Web Browsers:** Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Safari.
ğŸ‘‰ **Examples of Search Engines:** Google, Bing, Yahoo, and DuckDuckGo.
ğŸ‘‰ **How to Search:** Type what you want to find in the search box and click the search button.
ğŸ‘‰ **Be Specific:** Use clear words to get better search results. For example, instead of typing 'animals,' you can type 'African wild animals.'
ğŸ‘‰ **Check Sources:** Not everything online is true. Compare information from more than one website.

Understanding browsers and search engines helps you become a smart and safe digital learner.

sections.title: Working with Files
sections.content:
Files are where your computer stores all your work, such as documents, pictures, music, and videos. Every file has a **name** and a **type** (like .docx for Word or .jpg for pictures).

ğŸ‘‰ **Creating a File:** You can make a new file using programs like Microsoft Word, Paint, or Notepad.
ğŸ‘‰ **Opening a File:** Double-click the file icon or right-click and choose 'Open' to view or edit it.
ğŸ‘‰ **Saving a File:** Click 'Save' or press **Ctrl + S** to keep your work safely stored. Always save your file in the right folder so you can find it later.
ğŸ‘‰ **Renaming a File:** Click once on the file name, then type a new name that describes its content clearly.
ğŸ‘‰ **Organizing Files:** Store similar files in one folder, for example:
â€¢ A folder named *School Work* for assignments
â€¢ A folder named *Pictures* for images
â€¢ A folder named *Music* for songs
ğŸ‘‰ **Deleting Unwanted Files:** When a file is no longer useful, you can delete it. But be careful â€” always make sure before deleting!

Proper file management helps keep your computer neat and makes finding your work faster.

topics.title: What is Coding?
topics.content:
Coding means giving step-by-step instructions to a computer so it can perform tasks. It is like teaching the computer how to solve problems or create something new.

ğŸ‘‰ **Debugging:** Sometimes, programs have errors called *bugs*. Debugging means finding and fixing those errors so the program works correctly.

âœ… **In Summary:** Coding is the language computers understand. It teaches patience, logic, and creativity.

topics.title: Programming Languages for Kids
topics.content:
Computers cannot understand our spoken languages. They follow special sets of rules called **programming languages**. These help us communicate with computers clearly.

topics.title: Block Coding with Scratch

Block coding is a fun and easy way to learn programming. Instead of typing long codes, you use colorful blocks that fit together like puzzle pieces.

topics.title: Introduction to Text-Based Coding
topics.content:
Text-based coding uses written commands and symbols instead of blocks. It is used by professional programmers to build apps, games, and websites.

âœï¸ **Examples of Text Coding Languages:**
â€¢ **Python:** Simple, easy to learn, great for kids.

â€¢ **HTML:** Builds web pages.

ğŸ‘‰ **Differences from Block Coding:**

â€¢ You must spell and punctuate carefully.
â€¢ You get more control over how your program works.

print('Hello, Smart Kids!')
